INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 2024-05-01

INDICATION FOR OPERATION The patient presents with Not documented.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to the procedure were discussed with the patient in detail. The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

Not documented

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

Not documented

PROCEDURE

Thoracentesis (Detailed)

ANESTHESIA Local anesthesia (Lidocaine 1%)

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimal

COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality. Relevant procedural images were saved to the medical record.

Ultrasound Ultrasound identified a pleural effusion on the left side. Following sterile prep and local anesthesia, thoracentesis was performed at the 7th intercostal space along the mid-axillary line.
A total of 900 mL of serous fluid was removed. A post-procedure chest x-ray was ordered. The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Await final pathology and cytology. Post-procedure monitoring per protocol; obtain post-procedure chest imaging.
